intro: Riedelia klossii, commonly known as the Kloss's riedelia, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family, native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in rocky or mountainous areas. Its flowering period occurs during the wet season, and it is noted for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
